titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize LJS 63: Rāg darshan.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Treatise on the modes of Indian music, based on the fifth chapter of Mirza Khan's Tuḥfat al-hind. Visual representations of each mode depict a male Raga with between four and six female Raginis. The selection and sequence of Ragas and Raginis is according to the Hanuman system and the iconographic tradition of the images is that of Amber in Rajasthan. Other miniatures depict scenes at court and include images of the courtesan Māh-i Liqā, also known as Malaqa Bai; the author Khushhāl Khān; and the patron Rajah Rao Ranbha. The text is followed by a commentary.

author.name: Lawrence J. Schoenberg Collection (University of Pennsylvania)

supportDesc.extent: 43 leaves : 362 x 250 (290 x 198) mm bound to 367 x 260 mm

collation.p: Paper, iv (19th-century paper) + 43 + iv (19th-century paper); 1⁸ 2² 3⁸ 4⁴ 5¹² 6⁸(+1); early foliation in ink (f. 2-24), 2-8, 11-12, 9-10, 13-24, lower center recto; modern foliation in pencil, [1-43], upper left recto. References in this record are to the modern foliation. Catchwords on each leaf, lower left verso.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 4 columns of 19 lines; text block enclosed in narrow frame of silver and double lines in red ink, outer edge of margins delineated with single line of red ink..

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻlīq script in black and red ink by a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Illuminated headpiece (f. 1v) and 52 miniatures: 14 scenes of rulers or nobles (f. 2r-8r, 18r-24r), 1 of a lute (f. 5r), 36 of families of Ragas and Raginis (f. 8r-17r), and 1 group of 6 small landscapes (f. 17v).
Illuminated headpiece, f. 1v
Miniature, Nizam Alikhan Bahadur (Asaf Jah II) (sitting) and Amir A'zam Muthir al-Mulk (bowing), f. 2r
Miniature, Raja Rao Rabanha (?) Bahadur and Chanda Mimi (Bibi) Mah Nagabani (?), with attendants and red bird in cage, f. 2v
Miniature, Raja Rao Rabanha (?) Bahadur (on elephant), with Khushhal Khan (below), and soldiers, led by an elephant with orange banner, f. 3r
Miniature, Shah Adarang (?) Sahib (Mian Firuz Khan) with Tansin, Mian Karim Khan, and musicians, Shah Sadarang Sahib and Mian Ni'mat Khan, f. 3v
Miniature, Raja Rao Rabanha (?) Bahadur sitting with Khushbal Khan, f. 4r
Miniature, Raja Rao Rabanha (?) Bahadur with Shir Muhamad Khan Ima(n) and man with two tigers, f. 4v
Miniature, Lute, f. 5r
Miniature, Raja Rao Rabanha (?) Bahadur and man in Kurnool headdress, f. 5v
Miniature, Raja Rao Rabanha (?) Bahadur with Kurnool man and man with bird cage and bird on table, f. 8r
Miniature, Bhairav Raga, as Siva, f. 8r
Miniature, Malkus Raga, fanned by femal attendant and greeting a woman, f. 8v
Miniature, Hindol Raga and woman seated on swing, with three female attendants, f. 8v
Miniature, Todi Ragini holding vina, with four gazelles, one black and white with horns, f. 9r
Miniature, Gauri Ragini holding lute, with female attendant, f. 9r
Miniature, Gunakali Ragini beside white building, with female attendant, f. 9v
Miniature, Khanbhavati Ragini smoking beneath canopy, with three musicians and two dancers, f. 9v
Miniature, Vilaval Ragini seated and gazing into mirror held by one of two female attendants, f. 10r
Miniature, Lalit Ragini seated, with a blue-skinned, crowned figure at her feet and a female attendant holding a pitcher beside her, f. 10r
Miniature, Desakh Ragini, with wrestlers, juggler, acrobat, and archer, f. 10v
Miniature, Ramakali Ragini seated, with two female attendants, f. 10v
Miniature, Dipak Raga riding elephant, with four female attendants (illustration of Divali), f. 11r
Miniature, Sri Raga seated, with three female attendants, a musician playing a vina and a Kinnara (heavenly musician with a horse's head), f. 11r
Miniature, Megha Raga, as Krishna, holding a saber, with four female attendants, f. 11v
Miniature, Bhairavi Ragini tending Shiva shrine, with two female attendants, f. 11v
Miniature, Bhairav (or Vairari) Raga caressing a woman, with two female musicians, f. 12r
Miniature, Madhumadhavi Ragini kissing her lover, while a female attendant prepares their bedchamber, f. 12v
Miniature, Sindhavi Ragini tending a Siva altar with an ox, with two femal attendants, f. 12v
Miniature, Bangali Ragini and a female attendant, wearing only capes and culottes, receiving ritual instruction from Brahmin, who holds a trident, f. 12v
Miniature, Bavari Ragini, with meal placed on the ground, with a female attendant, f. 13r
Miniature, Patmanjari Ragini, conversing with an old woman, f. 13r
Miniature, Desi Raga (identified as Dipak Raga) with man standing before her, f. 13v
Miniature, Kamod Ragini holding a green bird, with a female musician, f. 13v
Miniature, Nat Ragini on horseback and holding a sword above decapitated body, about to attack a second enemy, f. 14r
Miniature, Kedara Ragini, wearing cape and culottes with a crescent moon on her forehead and sitting on tiger-skin run, with female attendant, f. 14r
Miniature, Kanara Ragini holding sword and shield, with white elephant with severed tusk and two male attendants, f. 14v
Miniature, Malasri Ragini with five female attendants, with one presenting a green bird, f. 14v
Miniature, Dhanasri Ragini (identified as Maru Ragini) sitting along beneath trees, gazing at city, f. 15r
Miniature, Maru Ragini (identified as Dhanasri Ragini) gazing at fountain, with female attendant, f. 15r
Miniature, Vasant Ragini, blue-skinned and crowned, with seven female musicians and dancers, f. 15v
Miniature, Asavari Ragini, blue-skinned, charming snakes and fish with wind instrument, with attendant sitting in tree, f. 15v
Miniature, Tanka Ragini reclining on bed, speaking with elderly woman, with female attendant massaging her feet, f. 16r
Miniature, Mallar Ragini, with female musician, female attendant massaging her hand, and two peacocks, f. 16r
Miniature, Gujari Ragini reclining and gazing at a black and white cat, f. 16v
Miniature, Bhupali Ragini, embraced by blue-skinned lover, with two female attendants, f. 16v
Miniature, Desakara Ragini (?) with lover and female attendant, f. 17r
Miniature, Six vignettes of different weather and seasons, including one scene of holi, f. 17v
Miniature, Raja Rao Bahadur hunting on horseback with bird and hound, with cheetah pulled on chariot, f. 18r
Miniature, Raja watching flock of birds, with bird man holding bird and net, f. 18v
Miniature, Raja watching horseman and man with staff, f. 19r
Miniature, Raja Rao Bahadur, with Khushal Khan, Djhazi Khan, and two musicians, f. 20r
Miniature, Holi Raja and Chanda Bibi with Khushal Khan and numerous attendants, f. 23v
Miniature, Chanda Bibi dancing for the Raja, f. 24r
Colophons, f. 24v

binding.p: 19th-century gilt morocco; binding label of Ghulam Qutabuddin Ahmad (label inside upper cover, transcribed and translated by Sudev Sheth).

origin.p: Written in the former princely state of Hyderabad in the Deccan region of India (Nizam of Hyderabad pictured on f. 2r), in 1799 (f. 24v, 43v), with the miniatures added by 1804 (dated signature, f. 24r).

history.provenance: Gift of Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2010.

Unidentified bookplate (inside upper cover); at one time held in Anūpa Saṃskr̥ta Pustakālaya, the Anup Sanskrit Library in the Bīkāner royal library until it was sold in the 1960s (Sheth-Fogg correspondence).
Sold by Sam Fogg Ltd. (London) to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, June 1996.
